website_summaries.verdict: There have been mixed reviews – some owners love it while others are frustrated. We think it's worth considering for those who want to try a smart lock without the hassle of installing a new deadbolt.
pros: A revamped second-generation of a popular smart lock that stands out for its simple design that works with existing deadbolts
Easy to install, and works with most smartphones
Also compatible with devices such as Alexa and Google Assistant
cons: Issues with it locking owners out of their homes and the face plate falling off have been reported
Batteries need replacement every few weeks

website_summaries.verdict: An older version of the Pro with a few kinks, but it can be used with +Connect to enhance reach and connectivity.
pros: Easy installation and works with existing hardware
Easy to assign access to family members and guests
Works with Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Alexa, and Siri
cons: Goes through batteries fast and doesn't alert you when they're dead
Problems with auto lock feature (says the door is locked when it's not)

website_summaries.verdict: August's HomeKit-enabled Smart Lock 2.0 improves on an already awesome product and is worth strong consideration -- even if you don't have an iPhone.
pros: From its improved design and easy install, to its simple software interface and top-notch performance, the $229 second-generation August Smart Lock does everything a little bit better
Oh, and it integrates with Siri via Apple's HomeKit software, as well as the Works with Nest platform
cons: The lock isn't compatible with every deadbolt, HomeKit can be challenging to get up and running, and the Siri integration won't matter to August's non-Apple users

customer_reviews.title: Fresh set of 4 batteries too lasted only 1 day
customer_reviews.text: Just received the latest version of August lock and installed it. Installing was a breeze. It upgraded the firmware by downloading and it took about 25 minutes. Soon after it started working, the battery indicator on the August App showed 20% capacity. By morning it showed 5% battery level and asked me to change the battery. I replaced with 4 new batteries. It started working well. But, next morning, it showed 20% battery capacity. The new set of 4 batteries also lasted only 1+ day. I have to remove and return this device. Am I the only one having this problem?
customer_reviews.author: Yes Dixit

customer_reviews.title: I tried my best to get it to work but could not
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item thinking it would install on my deadbolt. I understood it was universal. I had to call August and speak to a tech. I had a simple deadbolt lock and according to the picture on the instruction manual, my deadbolt should be compatible but it wasn't. The tech stated that the newer August lock (generation 2) changed their design and i would have to get a part from the old design (generation 1) and it may work. I tried my best to get it to work but could not. I returned the August lock back to Amazon where i was charged a shipping fee.
customer_reviews.author: west4087

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Terrible battery life that gives no warning until the lock is completly out of battery
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat Useless
customer_reviews.text: This is an exterior door lock that isn't water resistant. See the problem? Who's idea was this? But regardless, I live in a dry climate, and this thing only works occasionally. More often than not, it has some kind of communication error or jams. The jamming is funny, too, because the hole the bolt slides into is literally inch wider than it needs to be. I know, because I enlarged it several times to try to stop it from telling me it was jammed. Nice idea, but wait until a competent version comes out.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I am an electronic gadget junkie, I need to have the latest and greatest electronics, silly, I know, spoiled I may be but this is the best electronic that I have ever purchased! Works great, just make sure you have a level door! I live in Maine and it can get damn cold but the battery life in while on my unheated garage door has been 3 months before I needed to replace the batteries and it was -12! Works great even in the cold. I do not have the bridge, if someone needs to get in I can just send them a temporary pass...easy-peasy!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Moore

customer_reviews.title: Such a great idea, but don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This product worked perfectly until we were about a month and a half in. Then, we started having connectivity issues. We have had some major problems that led to our dogs being locked in our apartment without our dog walkers being able to get in and out of town visitors being left out in the cold. Such a great idea, but don't waste your money. They haven't figured out how to make this product stable, and the customer support is abysmal...no response from customer support.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: It’s not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: I really like how it looks and it’s a great idea unfortunately it needs a WiFi bridge and it pretty much only works with Bluetooth (sometimes) with out it. August should include a connect with the lock at no cost to the customer for this I kinda feel cheated on the product. I purchased a used WiFi connect on eBay and that was a bad idea because, well it won’t work. August is proving customer support but I’m finding the product to be difficult and too troublesome. I should of gone with something simpler and easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Pink

customer_reviews.title: Really annoying lock.
customer_reviews.text: The lock is easy to install and has a long battery life. I end up changing batteries 3 times a year. It takes 4 AA batteries and the set up is easy. My biggest gripe about this product is that it is slow as hell!!! It's also temperamental. I have the August Wifi bridge and even though the bridge and lock are close together, it works 50% of time. It also doesn't work during the worse possible times and I keep getting the "remote feature is unavailable. I tried to do all troubleshooting for it and it still does the same. Annoying as hell!!
customer_reviews.author: Latin Assassin

customer_reviews.title: Freedom to roam, peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: Thank goodness I have my husband to install it, so I can’t comment on how well that went. But now that it’s up and running, I love it and use it all the time! It’s a piece of cake to use, and I can’t tell you the number of times it has been handy - when I am halfway out of my drive or when I find myself on the opposite side of the house than where I exited, where the door is still locked. It really allows me to walk freely with the dogs, not being tied to a certain door if I don’t have my keys on me. I just love the freedom and reassurance!
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Keys

customer_reviews.title: jammed
customer_reviews.text: it used to work great. after 2 month of use it malfunctioned and my wife got stuck in the house. She could not turn the knob inside. If there were an emergency my family would have been unable to leave the house through the door. It turned out that the motor prevented the knob to turn. If this happens you have to forcefully turn the knob to turn the motor inside the lock. The lock has now jammed several times and I have no idea why. I am now returning the lock and expect a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Hulla

customer_reviews.title: Easier and more reliable than Kevo
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Nothing less than RELIABLE for us, now for many months! I had been researching other brands, but didn't like the inconsistencies of my father-in-law's Kevo. I was so glad I didn't have to replace our entire door locks with the August, since it works with our existing deadbolt (which was designer, so I didn't want to remove it). This is how our AirBnB guests enter our space, and no one has ever had a problem. It's easy to install and easy to use. The app is great, too.. love being able to see when our guests come and go (it even shows whether they lock the door manually, or via the app).
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: NOT WIFI ENABLED, HAD TO MODIFY LOCK PIN ADAPTER TO MAKE IT WORK.
customer_reviews.text: The app is super sketchy on android it says "In the neighborhood" when I'm 2 miles away, this comes up for "Wifi smart lock" but No you have to buy the $80 hub to lock and unlock remotely (seriously that's RIDICULOUS, I just made one with a $20 raspberry pi I had laying around) I wish I could give it 5 stars but it had to be modified to fit my lock pin, then the whole not having wifi thing... August is 100% holding back and grabbing for every penny. I'll be going with a different brand next time since they want nearly $300 for a smart lock with BASIC ardino style parts crammed in it.
customer_reviews.author: NikG

customer_reviews.title: This Lock is not durable!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the second generation in June 2018 and now after less than two years it has picked up a fault and will not operate. Lock says its jammed when it definitely is not and will not calibrate either. There is an accelerometer inside which tells the lock what position it is at (Locked or Unlocked), I think this is not working. Of course it's out of warranty and therefore junk. I'm sure there are more durable locks out there for the price. Very disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: A Sadeghi

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this
customer_reviews.text: ---Pros--- Easy as pie to install Works great ---Cons--- NONE ---Bottom Line--- LOVE this, We got it to make it easier on an older individual to gain access to the house. We purchased it with the Keypad and this individual has no issues operating the lock. (Poor Eyesite No technical ability stubborn has memory issues the list can go on and on and on )
customer_reviews.author: Beth Yacoub

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Although I think the cost of these is a bit high since it isn’t really a lock, the functionality you get is so good it’s worth the money. Installs quickly and easily, pairing and setup takes a little longer due to firmware update and account setup. Apple HomeKit needs some work, it’s a bit buggy still but not a knock on the unit itself. Love being able to give my kids permanent access without a key, I also like the reporting function. All in all a killer deal at <$150 on sale. My first smart home product, it will definitely persuade me to expand to more smart home products. Looking at the doorbell from August now.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: I love this lock
customer_reviews.text: I love this lock. As I work out of town I am able to lock and unlock the house for anyone I have coming to visit (although it required a seperate August connect at 79.95) Instillation was very simple other than the fact that the trim of my door was to close to the original lock and the latches that secure it were not able to open and close. I just cut a small notch it the trim and secured the lock to the door. overall a great product if you are constantly loosing your keys or out of town on a regular basis and need to give access to your house while away.
customer_reviews.author: Grayson Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Beware! Do not buy an August lock!
customer_reviews.text: August are a bunch of charlatens and do not stand behind their products. I had my August HomeKit deadbolt fail this week, the motor completely gave out within 2 years and they have refused to support it saying it is out of warranty. If you want to buy a $200 lock that lasts 18 months then buy August. Otherwise go for an alternative. I used to be an advocate - but after my experience with them this week I would advise everyone to keep away from them entirely.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient
customer_reviews.text: This has come a long way for me. When I first got it I'd give it maybe 2-3 stars. Now, it unlocks the door every time for me and when you have your hands full of kids, or groceries, it makes all the difference to not have to worry about locking or unlocking the door. Very nifty, and I plan on adding on the August Doorbell, so that if I have guests coming over, I can remotely unlock the door for them from the back yard or where ever we happen to be.
customer_reviews.author: rickuski

customer_reviews.title: Great idea that does not work!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. Great idea however it does not work. 2 out of ten 10 it would open. Most of the time I had to spent few minutes in front of the door with my phone, look for the app and open the door. It was quicker using a key. On few occasions the lock would open on its own while I was inside the house doing something in the kitchen. Also it's not a lock, it's an addition to a deadbolt that needs to be installed on the door. The kicker is that it does not work with all deadbolts. Look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Major security risk, door unlocked by itself!
customer_reviews.text: I've had the whole August lock suite of products for over 6 months now. Although it was never perfect. It worked well enough for me to put up with. Although recently with the iOS update. The door stopped auto unlocking when arriving home. A nuisance. However, the door unlocked itseld his morning when everyone was home. I was sent an alert. You can see how this is a huge risk to my family and I. Customer service has not been helpful.
customer_reviews.author: midnyite

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for market
customer_reviews.text: My phone takes at least 15 seconds to connect to the lock, even with the wifi bridge. To me, this defeats the purpose, nobody wants to stand outside their door waiting 15+ seconds to be let in. Technology is better than this. In a world where IoT devices feel 'snappy' (think Alexa, Hue, Wemo), August feels like it's fallen incredibly far behind. If they ever solve the connection time issue I'll be sure to come back and update my review, but as of now I'd absolutely return this if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Too finicky
customer_reviews.text: Worked well at first but has been pretty finicky after about two months so I don’t even bother anymore. I now just have an expensive deadbolt. I will admit I don’t have much patience so it can probably be fixed but I was looking for something that was pretty easy to use and just worked without a lot of adjustments. If you have time/patience, this may work for you. If you want something closer to out of the box, I wouldn’t recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonRob

customer_reviews.title: Breaks after 2 years, company won’t fix
customer_reviews.text: This lock worked great for approximately 2 years, then nope! Working with support was a waste of time. Both our locks are broken. The company offered a 25% discount on new locks. Fat chance. Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice, no! I’ll find a company that stands behind its products. A one year warranty for a $200 lock is ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy A Sorrels

customer_reviews.title: Great lock
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lock because I was tired of having my hands full and having to put stuff down to unlock my door. This has solved that problem and I would never go back to not having it. A complete game changer. Knowing that my door will always be locked because of the auto lock feature gives me that sense of security.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pershing

customer_reviews.title: if you have weather stripping.. Dont Buy the lock
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money... the app takes to long to load... and my front door has the weather strip... so you have to pull the door to lock the door... that process makes the lock halfway useless... the only good part is about 65% of the time i come home the app will work and automatically unlock the door for me... But it doesn't work all the time... its hit or miss... soo if the price point was under 70$.. it would be an awesome buy.. because the best it can do remotely is unlock the door...
customer_reviews.author: Kohls83

customer_reviews.title: Requires too often change of batteries
customer_reviews.text: I have a love/hate reaction to this lock. It requires 4 AA batteries to operate. It was installed on 7/16/17. On 10/30.I received an email from Team August with a warning that there were 2 weeks of battery life left, so I put in new batteries. On 11/17, 18 days later, I got another warning "about 2 weeks of life left." I would like to know why the first batteries lasted longer. They came from the same Homedepot package. Within the next 2 weeks I will change them again and at the same time buy stock in Duracell.
customer_reviews.author: BF

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with certain schlage Deadbolts
customer_reviews.text: Would not work on my schlage deadbolt. It would not full extend or retract even when not closed. I think I have a long throw extra secure deadbolt is why it does not work. I like the concept, but check to make sure your lock is compatible.
customer_reviews.author: JCT

customer_reviews.title: Some drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: Great lock. I give it four stars because there should be more adapter choices in the package. My door chamber was too small for the adapter. I had to add a few layers of hard plastic within the adapter to help it fit snuggly to the smart lock. This is also so that the lock would actually grip the chamber and unlock the door. This made installlation longer than advertised. I am happy that the lock works however adding the bridge to the package would have been a plus for this item. You cannot operate the lock using Alexa without the bridge.
customer_reviews.author: Family

customer_reviews.title: The future is here!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about this device. Gone of the days of handing out keys! True story... 2 hours after I installed the lock and the August Connect, I was over at a friends house. A relative called me and urgently needed to retrieve a set of his door keys that he had accidentally left at my house. I was able to unlock the door while being away from my home, and lock it back after he left. Quite amazing... And the irony of the situation does not escape me. It is not cheap, but it is an amazing product.
customer_reviews.author: Xioo

customer_reviews.title: What a convenience!!!👍
customer_reviews.text: The 2nd gen August Smart Lock works fantastic! I had one issue in the calibration (my fault) when I first got it, but the August customer service helped me through it. The customer support team is top notch, very kind and helpful. The unit itself is very easy to install and when used with the optional Connect you can check if the door is locked from anywhere (as long as you have an internet connection)! The app works wonderful on my iPhone. It also is Home Kit certified, which fits right in with my connected house. Also works with Alexa!😎 I'm a happy customer!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick S.

customer_reviews.title: August door locks
customer_reviews.text: I love these locks. They also work with Apple TV system which is what I have. Is you forget get to lock them st night they automatically lock the doors.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Diehl

customer_reviews.title: Do your research.
customer_reviews.text: I love being able to unlock my door without a key. I also purchased the keypad and connect. I'm only giving it 4 stars because since the most recent update the auto unlock feature is glitchy at best and only works part of the time. It is a good product but it worked better until the update. Hopefully August will fix the glitches soon. Everything else works well. I don't know if I would be happy with it without the keypad. I will say that it works 95% of the time. Every so often I have to enter my code twice but that doesn't bother me much.
customer_reviews.author: zero

customer_reviews.title: Once again don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This device is not worth the money 💰. It doesn't recognize when walk around the block, i have to I leave the house more than 100 feet so it can unlock automatically. It doesn't always open when I press the button. This company doesn't have a customer service department and I have sent them 4 messages and have never heard from anyone. Once again don't waste your money. I'm going to return this crap.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Contacted August and they kept telling me my smart connect was too far away or it must be ...
customer_reviews.text: Had problems with the smartlock around 3-4 months in, the lock would not respond to any smartphone. Contacted August and they kept telling me my smart connect was too far away or it must be my phone, but trying on multiple phones it still wouldnt work. The smart connect takes an age to connect with the lock when it works. The fact that it is so temperamental and the service has been so poor, i could not ever recommend purchasing one of these to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Nicholls

customer_reviews.title: The best smart lock.
customer_reviews.text: An excellent product. You will need the August connect if you want to use it properly. The reason I gave it 4 stars is because I was hoping they would work with the wink hub without needing the august connect as I do not want to buy all different hubs. Other than that it seems to do its job well. I like the feature where it unlocks the door when I come back near my house and of course
customer_reviews.author: Ramki

customer_reviews.title: Auto-unlock saves the bike rider coming home
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this smart lock for one week now. And the auto-unlock feature works great. Every day I come home with my hands taking my bike and packages, and sometimes letters in my mouth. It's super hard for me to put everything on the ground, get the keys from the backpack, open the door, pick everything up, and get in. The auto-unlock kicks in at the perfect timing (when I just arrive in front the door) so far. And it works stably. The set up process is also very intuitive. I love this product.
customer_reviews.author: grapeot

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my business. Have several people that need access at all hours of all days. Had problems with people losing keys and not returning them when they stopped working for us. Only installed the August this week but already making a big difference in convenience. Definitely get the wifi connection add-on though so you can open remotely and check on its status remotely. It's also great as a backup in case of issues with bluetooth. One week in, i love it
customer_reviews.author: camerafool

customer_reviews.title: Plan on replacing within a few years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a year or so ago. At first it was great, no problems. For the last 3 months or so, even after immediately changing the batteries, it says low battery and the lock won't cooperate. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time and money
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews but after using this lock for almost a year I am totally disappointed with my purchase. It takes about 20 seconds for the lock to lock out unlock once you're next to it. Many times it won't recognize you at all. I've been locked out multiple times. Dozens of times I've had the urge to destroy this thing with a hammer. I added the wifi adon to it and that offered to help. Poor technology.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P.

customer_reviews.title: Can't connect remotely without additional equipment. Only if in Bluetooth range.
customer_reviews.text: In order to access your Smart Lock remotely through the wifi, you would need an August bridge of wifi between your lock and router. You will need an August bridge setup (August Connect or Doorbell Cam) or an Apple TV 4th Gen setup within Bluetooth range of the Smart Lock. This can also be used as a wifi bridge for the remote functionalities of your Smart Lock.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Good lock, limited functionality
customer_reviews.text: I love the Bluetooth feature on approach, where it will automatically unlock your door when you get within the proximity. However it doesn’t always work, or it will be delayed by 10 mins. Connecting to it can take some time as well. I do like how my Amazon echo can tell August to lock our front door! Too bad the unlock feature isn’t support by Echo yet. I don’t like how it doesn’t contain Z-Wave or Zigbee though :(
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Valencia

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best electronic lock from ease of use to install and a great app that actually works all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus T.

customer_reviews.title: Like others have said
customer_reviews.text: Like others have said, its buggy. Unreliable too often. It should be smart enough to know someone is still home, or the phone is in the house, when auto-lock is on, if we step out, it locked on us!! Takes too long all the time to register someone came home for the Auto-Unlock feature. Cant get it to link with Alexa. I am an IT professional, we are using newest Android phones. Think I'll switch to a bluetooth/wifi/keypad/bio type of lock that works good enough to earn 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: James P. George

customer_reviews.title: If Only The Video Was "Real Life"
customer_reviews.text: Does not work as advertised; I am returning it. The BT connectivity takes way too long; 50% of the time (even when I am standing within 10' (line of sight with no obstruction), my Galaxy S6 won't connect to the lock. Also, the auto unlock feature (why I purchased this lock) takes way too long. I have to walk up onto my porch and wait 20-40 seconds for the lock to unlock. It is much faster to use a key.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to get used to
customer_reviews.text: Have these at both of my main doors. They open as we approach, as long as we're carrying our iPhones, & lock automagically a few minutes later. I've gotten really spoiled by these locks. They weren't cheap but since we use our doors constantly, I feel they were a great investment. It's also nice to be able to open doors remotely to let people inside (like family, friends, delivery people, etc.) without having to hand out physical keys.
customer_reviews.author: ccs93Top Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Careful to see that it will fit
customer_reviews.text: I have a window in my doof so I cannot attach the lock to the back plate. Other than that it appeas well built and sleek. I bought it over a year ago with the intention of installing it in my new home and how it doesnt work with the windows... Pretty sad especially since the door in the ad has windows.
customer_reviews.author: L D Parker

customer_reviews.title: I really liked this lock
customer_reviews.text: Initially, I really liked this lock, but there is a problem with how long the batteries last. They say on the website the batteries should last 6-9 months, but we're getting notifications about batteries needing changing after only 60 days. I wouldn't necessarily mind replacing batteries that often, but this is installed on a vacation house that may be empty for 60 days between visits. So, even without using the lock, the batteries still are being used up.
customer_reviews.author: Paco

customer_reviews.title: It’s Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I like it a lot! It is sleek and easy to use. The only point of concern that I note is with the auto lock feature. If you set the threshold too low and you are unloading groceries or walking the dog, you run the risk of a lock out if you don’t remember your phone. Thank goodness for my smart watch!
customer_reviews.author: Beas

customer_reviews.title: Is it worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this 3 stars becuase, mainly the cost of the lock it self. The lock it self is very nice and impressive. Very easy to install less than 10 min. Had issues at first with the lock jamming if the door wasn't lined up perfectly. Another annoying factor is having to spend 45 dollars for the wifi connect to have more advanced geofacing and to work with alexa. But otherwise satisfied with the product
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: The August lock works great. VERY easy to install
customer_reviews.text: The August lock works great. VERY easy to install. JUST unscrew the (2) screws on inside of door and remove, place the provided metal plate on the door with the (2) screws that came from the lock that was originally on your door, screw that on tight. Then open the August lock clasps and place them on the metal frame. Lock the clasps on the metal frame and wa-la! Piece of cake, great piece of art.
customer_reviews.author: Lorrie Vail Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Works great unless you need to unlock the door remotely
customer_reviews.text: The remote unlock with the bridge took as long at 20 minutes sometimes. I was hoping to use this for Airbnb guests but wound up sending it back. Such a shame. I had my hopes up. Also, the bridge was located within five feet of the door. I purchased the newest version of the lock.
customer_reviews.author: infoglutton

customer_reviews.title: I think this is OK, but need more experience.
customer_reviews.text: Software is a little wonky, but the device looks nicer than any other keypad devices and mechanically works well. Seems to know when we are near and auto-unlocks door when we approach. Often get notifications that it cant connect bwtn the phone and door lock, but it seems to still work. You need to get the $80 base station to make the lock work via the internet. So far, ok, but the jury is still partially out.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: The August lock works really well. I bought the bridge too so I can access the lock from outside our wifi network and it has been really helpful. The integration with Alexa is great. She won't unlock the door because of safety reasons but she will check to see if it's locked and lock it if it isn't. I also love that you can't tell from the outside of the house that we have a smart lock.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap. And the app sucks.
customer_reviews.text: The lock mechanisms insides feel very cheap. After 1.5 years of using it, it hasn't gotten any better. It is very weak now and has issues locking and unlocking all the time. It has issues with auto unlocking when my wife or I get home, and it's frustrating because that's why I got it in the first place. I've got almost $400 into this system with the lock, doorbell and connect and can say that they are all junk. Save your time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Great but requires a bridge to work with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: I've had this a few days and it seems to work well. I didn't read the fine print and went to setup Alexa to use with this lock only to discover it needs yet another single use bridge. Works with Homekit without one but required for Alexa which was a big disappointment. There is also no Smarting support as of yet, hopefully, they will add it and not have it require a bridge.
customer_reviews.author: Cory L

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my smart home
customer_reviews.text: Just got my Lock in the mail. Installation - easy took a few minutes followed videos on website. So far I have no complaints, I bought 2nd generation to save a couple bucks and I don’t need access with Alexa so didn’t need to spend more. I will update after using for a while, but so far I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Connected once through bluetooth, now will not connect - No resolution from August Support - Huge waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: The lock has a shoddy bluetooth setup and connection. It worked one time, now I cannot connect to the lock. I am using a compatible phone, HTC One M8, with android version 6.0. I've tried all combinations of removing batteries, uninstalling app, reinstalling app, restarting bluetooth, unpairing, pairing, nothing works. August support cannot help either. This is a huge waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: TimO

customer_reviews.title: August lock broke after just 1 year
customer_reviews.text: I loved the August Smart Lock while it was working. It made entry into my home (for myself and guests) much more convenient. However, after one year and 3 months of using the lock, it broke down... and the August customer service team would not do anything to help (since the warranty was only good for one year). Their suggestion was to buy a new lock. I will certainly not be purchasing anything from August again.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Straka

customer_reviews.title: 2nd gen recommended
customer_reviews.text: It works every time and I've especially enjoyed the increased functionality since I added some of the other items in the line. 4 stars instead of 5 because it is sometimes slower than I'd like. The app is easy to use and setting up interactions with other smart home gear has been fairly simple. I recommend it without reservation.
customer_reviews.author: Gena P

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic when it works.
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty big which confuses first time guests but it looks good. I just wish it worked consistently. When it does work, I walk right in the front door when I get home and it's fantastic. But too often I have to get out my key and let myself in. We can't figure out why and when it doesn't recognize us.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Ohlenkamp

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I have Purchased two now and within six month they both stopped working . I have contacted the company four times with no results waste of money !!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Buss

customer_reviews.title: It's super convenient. The app is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It's super convenient. The app is easy to use. I can leave the house and not worry about whether or not I remembered to lock the door because it automatically locks. It's great for granting temporary guest access. And I can still use my physical key if I need it.
customer_reviews.author: AbbyNormal

customer_reviews.title: Glad I waited since the Gen 2 Homekit compatible model ...
customer_reviews.text: I had installed a Schlage Sense touchpad deadbolt since the August Generation 1 model was buggy and had all sorts of issues. Glad I waited since the Gen 2 Homekit compatible model is awesome and has no bugs and works great. I switched out the horrible Schlage sense and replaced it with 2 August and keypads and it works beautifully. I love all the features and the install was simple and easy and I am glad I waited!
customer_reviews.author: Michael M

customer_reviews.title: I hope ur neighbors don't have one also....ugh
customer_reviews.text: Let's hope ur neighbors don't have one also. I had to walk away from my house to get the lock to work. I live in a row house and it was challenging, but once I was away and it installed it works great. I can control the door from my iwatch and it works great....
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Colzie

customer_reviews.title: Great device for a fledgling smart home
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this device. It's been a great addition to my fledgling smart home. And it works almost without fail. I can count on one hand the number of times it's had a hiccough and with the app and the keypad which I also purchased that has never been a deal breaking issue. The addition of Siri integration is great and makes it super easy to check the status of your door.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Orem

customer_reviews.title: the app is not awesome. Notifications from home app work well and really ...
customer_reviews.text: Lock works well, the app is not awesome. Notifications from home app work well and really it's more reliable when away to use the home app on iOS. Only big complaint is the size of the mounting is too wide for some doors with windows (clips to secure it bumped into the window frame to the point I could not mount effectively). Hoping the come out with a smaller version and i'll revisit for 5 stars, in spite of the app.
customer_reviews.author: stefano

customer_reviews.title: Good Product and works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Good Product and works as advertised. I assumed the WIFI enabling attachment comes standard but it doesnt. I wish it was, they can raise the price of product by 20 - 25$. I do not wish to pay additional 80$ for the same. Yes the size is big, its no where what you see in videos or product demo. The AUGUST version 2.0 is a bit different then 1.0 in terms of plates etc, please make a new video with Single Plate option on your website. Overall - the product is good and works. I have used for 3-4 days so far and it has been working. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: SLF

customer_reviews.title: August DUMB Lock 2nd Generation
customer_reviews.text: This is not a smart lock. It's actually a dumb lock. Dumber than regular lock. Initial set up is not working. It wouldn't discover on my phone, and the tech support is clueless. It suppose to be simple to work, but it was difficult to set it up. Maybe I had defective one, but regardless, it is 180 bucks lock.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Kim

customer_reviews.title: Watch Out for August warranty and replacement
customer_reviews.text: broke down after 6 months. they sent me a replacement but now the replacement doesnt work and they are telling me that the warranty is from the date of purchase and they are not willing to change it or even fix it. buy something else that works.
customer_reviews.author: joseph golshan

customer_reviews.title: Just hope it fails during the warranty period then mabey support will be able to help
customer_reviews.text: Lock worked great for first 18 months. No support from August and no repair. It is as if they just walked away from their earlier hardware.
customer_reviews.author: justin

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This “smart” lock doesn’t seem to recognize when I’m within range in a reasonable amount of time and thus, the auto-unlock function is frustratingly incompetent. The auto-lock function doesn’t have a home/away setting, so it will just lock itself even if the door is propped open. All in all, I’m supremely disappointed that this product doesn’t function as described by the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Frank B.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions, downloaded the app, and received a message "unavoidable error" when I tried to register. Multiple times. Dont waste your time
customer_reviews.author: Sam Putrah

customer_reviews.title: Locked out. Returning.
customer_reviews.text: Loved this idea for my apartment. I have two roommates who are a little forgetful when locking the door. It gave all of us great peace of mind. Too bad it never worked. Nothing promised of this device works, including the August Connect. I'm currently sitting outside of my apartment, locked out...for the second time this week. Product support over the phone is useless. Can't wait for my refund.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Good idea but implementation is junk
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of having a smart lock, but this version of it just isn't there yet. It's plasticky, under powered (needs perfectly aligned doors), expensive and buggy. It's also not connected to the internet without an additional purchase, thus missing out on a bunch of useful features. Maybe some day, but this isn't ready.
customer_reviews.author: barbermot

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give zero stars I would. I’m not sure where to begin with this lock. You have to replace the batteries every couple weeks. The lock gets jammed and won’t function. You don’t always get notifications. It doesn’t always connect with your Bluetooth. When it works it’s great but most of the time it doesn’t. I don’t recommend wasting your money.
customer_reviews.author: BusyMom28

customer_reviews.title: August Smart Lock a total disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I wasted an hour and one half or more trying to get this product to work. Installation program hung while trying to update firmware. This was one of my worst experiences with a technology device. I may have to hire a locksmith because after removing the August lock, I was not able to properly reinstall the original lock.
customer_reviews.author: Chet Lustgarten

customer_reviews.title: No more August!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lock Nov. 2016. Yesterday it jammed up internally. It might make a good paperweight. Sometimes it worked well, other times, erratically. My camera/doorbell is fine though.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Bunch Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: So far this product is amazing! Perfect for letting people into your house especially if you have a Ring doorbell. The cost may add up if you purchase wifi adapter and the keypad but it is definitely worth it. I in fact have lost my actual key to my home because August unlocks as soon as I pull into my driveway!
customer_reviews.author: _DjBacon

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I don't like is the fact that you need four new batteries every so often. Other than that I love this product.
customer_reviews.author: K Bolanos

customer_reviews.title: More trouble than it's worth
customer_reviews.text: Installed Friday, tried it out over the weekend. I purchased this for the convenience, and so far it's not worth keeping. It takes 10-15 seconds to connect just so i can unlock the door, I could have used the key in less time than that. Twice it unlocked by itself, according to the log one of those times was while we weren't home. The auto-unlock worked once, has not worked again since. Extremely disappointing all around.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B. Bouvier

customer_reviews.title: The lock doesn’t lock
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed the device for many months. It even worked outdoors within a Tupperware case I made for it to protect the lock from the elements. But then I realized that all the times I thought I was remotely locking the device via WiFi - my house was completely open. Pretty big flaw for a lock- the app reports your house is locked - but it’s not. The only way to really know if you have remote locked the device is to stand in front of it or check the activity log.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. I've been locked out because of the product not working more times than I care to count. Eventually had to uninstall it and throw this garbage away.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. Only had the lock for 3 day's and started to have problems with it connecting. I called there customer service line and was told to return it and there is a known defect, so I ask what is the firmware version so I don't repurchase. Long story short they could help and told me sorry but we don't care if you a customer. So Buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: Lyman Phibbs

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this lock! It’s a must have very easy to change the battery’s as well as install. my door also takes a little muscle to lock. The lock has no issues. If it’s gets thrown off and will not lock just recalibrate it, Iv only had to do this once.
customer_reviews.author: samantha haley

customer_reviews.title: Must have if you forget to lock your house a lot
customer_reviews.text: I like the lock a lot but still could be improved. Wish I could unlock it via internet without having to buy a compatible hub. As of now, I can only unlock it when my phone is close enough to recognize it via bluetooth. Still, I would buy it again. I love how I can set a timer so it automatically locks after a certain period of time after I leave the house.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Not ready to deploy
customer_reviews.text: This lock is not ready for prime time. I have used this lock for three months. I replace the batteries once; documentation says shouldn't have to replace batteries for six months. Eight of my nine invited guests have not been able to get this to work for them, even after calling August tech-support. Tech-support claims they're coming out with a new version sometime but by the time we have called tech-support frustration level is really high. Guests should not have to create an yet another account that has the potential of being hacked and exposing personal identification. This product is not worth your time or money.
customer_reviews.author: Volcano Man

customer_reviews.title: Get the RING instead
customer_reviews.text: 2nd review of this peice of junk Work's for about 2weeks Then it's just making noise and doesn't unlock. Tried to write my first review and it got sent back Go buy the RING. My neighbor has it and that's what I'll be getting today and selling this for dirt cheap if anyone wants a paper wieght
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is pretty bad
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this since 2016 and the main issue is the battery life. And the connect accessory keep getting disconnected.
customer_reviews.author: quis

customer_reviews.title: Battery life non-existant!
customer_reviews.text: The lock itself does the job that it is supposed to even though with some glitches. The biggest headache however is the battery use. We purchased two of these locks and have been literally going through 4 batteries every 3 weeks for each one! We have had these for over 3 months now. August customer service did not offer much of help just suggesting “the screws might be too tight!” I definitely would not recommend and will try to seek to return the item.
customer_reviews.author: Talkh

customer_reviews.title: Maybe Gen 3 will nail it...
customer_reviews.text: I really, really, really wanted to like this thing, It was much bigger than I expected, included pretty much no instructions and I was not able to get it to pair with my phone. The account setup was somewhat of a joke, I uploaded a picture of a bacon egg and cheese sandwich as my profile pic ( they said a picture is required for identification ) While I was googling my other issues I figured out that I also had to buy a bridge for another 60-70 bucks to access this remotely. I immediately gave up and boxed the thing back up. Just wasn't for me.
customer_reviews.author: James E.

customer_reviews.title: Great Option if Your Time is Worth Nothing
customer_reviews.text: Don’t do it don’t do it don’t do it. If this thing actually worked it would be amazing but it is just a tee-total piece of garbage. It never connects right. The troubleshooting pages send you in an endless loop. If you have hours and hours and hours to devote to troubleshooting then this is the lock for you. If your time is worth more than .20 or .30 per hour then you may want to devote your resources to buying another lock. Oh how I wish I could force the CEO of this company to actually endure the start to finish process of getting this garbage lock to work.
customer_reviews.author: Neal

customer_reviews.title: Bought the lock, ad said home kit enabled, ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought the lock, ad said home kit enabled, once installed, home kit doesn't work, called mfg said it would be several weeks for new update
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: cation read and understand more equipment need for echo and wifi
customer_reviews.text: A little deceiving you need another piece of equipment if you want to control from wifi Just an expensive lock that falls short its more a dumb lock
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Great lock for Airbnb business
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Airbnb business. The lock did not come with an installation manual, but Augusta provides one online. Installation and setup were both a breeze. The lock and the app both work great! I set it up for remote access and put in an external keypad, both of which work great.
customer_reviews.author: Ilya

customer_reviews.title: Product has several flaws
customer_reviews.text: The front face pops up, the app has issues connecting to devices, and some things the lock opens 90% of the way which doesn't unlock it. For over $200 on a Co. Potent that gets attached to an existing lock, it's flawed
customer_reviews.author: The incredible bulk

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install - easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I installed august all by myself, using the booklet and videos I found on YouTube. I absolutely love my august lock. It's made my life SO much easier, by not having to run up and down 2 flights of stairs to open my door. I have august connect also, so I can open the door (or lock it) from anywhere like work, the gym, my dentist, even China!
customer_reviews.author: xojulesox

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Installation was easy and it hooked up with HomeKit with no issues. I'm really loving the peace of mind of actually knowing for sure that my doors are locked every night. No unresponsiveness or connection issues that I've witnessed yet, but it's still early and I also have my AppleTV located nearby.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffanie

customer_reviews.title: This thing does not work!
customer_reviews.text: This thing does not work! Set it up on my front door. Easy set up. Would not move the deadbolt after using it for about two days. Couldn’t even manually unlock the deadbolt using the August. Called August customer service. Had me recalibrate the lock. Started to use it again. This time it didnt work 10 minutes after the recalibration. Called CS again, did the same recalibration. Again stopped working. August sent me a Gen 3 lock. Again, it did not work. I even move the new lock to a different door....still the same result. Out $150. Cool idea, bad execution!
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Harkins

customer_reviews.title: Connectivity can be an issue...
customer_reviews.text: Having never owned a different smart lock, I have nothing to compare the August to. It’s great though and I’ve enjoyed using it. It does fail to connect sometimes, but it’s not too bad. The batteries died once and the only indication was that it wouldn’t connect to my phone even if I was right next to it. A better battery indicator would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: you know, that guy with the face

customer_reviews.title: Great buy while on sale. Might have better results with 3rd gen
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good. Wish it was a little faster over Apple TV bridge. Apple Watch app doesn’t work consistently. Didn’t work with double barrel deadbolt (key on both sides)
customer_reviews.author: GD

product_meta.title: August Smart Lock (HomeKit Enabled / Dark Gray)
product_meta.description:
No more fumbling for keys. Control access to your home with Amazon Alexa, Apple Home Kit or your smartphone. Auto-unlocks your door as you approach and automatically locks your door after you enter. No more hiding keys under the mat with virtual keys, and the 24/7 activity log lets you know who opens you door and when. Your exterior door hardware stays the same. August Smart Lock replaces only the interior of your standard deadbolt. Install yourself in minutes. 

Disclaimer
Warranty is only effective for US and Canada customers.
feature_bullets: Works with Alexa for voice control (hub required, Alexa device and hub sold separately).

Connect your August smart lock to Alexa to Lock, unlock and check lock status. Alexa can also provide notifications when your battery is running low so you can proactively replace them. Set up smart reorders through dash replenishment to make sure you always have replacement batteries when you need them.

specifications.Pattern: Apple HomeKit, Android, Amazon Alexa, and Nest
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars2,049 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
